TopicTitle: Kerbal Space Program - Update 0.23 Now Available

Articles.Content:
<p><a href="http://bit.ly/1hi7Yw7"><img alt="image" src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/4f3870bcfd856e39579786ae2d601e45/tumblr_inline_mxyvo82BbM1rr2wit.jpg"/></a></p>

<p><em><strong>Kerbal Space Program</strong></em> update 0.23 is ready for liftoff! The new update is now live and available for download on Steam or through your game patcher.</p>

Liftoff! We have a liftoff! Only one bug after 3 minutes of playing!

*Rumble rumble*

RAPIER Test sucessful

Thanks for the great update!
It's here!
The website is down, too many MySQL connections. What about torrent seeds for paid users? (Although it's hard to log in either at this moment.)

ERMAGHERDERMAGHERDERMAGHERDERMAGHERDERMAGHERDERMAGHERDERMAGHERD11!!!1111!!!!!1!1!11111

:D:D:D:D

*goes to Squad*

*finds devs of KSP*

...kees me. o-o
can someone explain how the upgrade to unity 4.2.2 will affect gameplay compared to 0.22 please? Like will there be a visual improvement or is it more performance related
It's performance related, and some unity bugs were fixed
I hope I will get a steady FPS at last playing this game.

It's performance related, and some unity bugs were fixed

Notably, this:
Thanks team.
There is a whole building inside of my SPH, it seems to be set sideways, I can also see grass. It actually looks like a smaller model of one of the outside buildings, but vertical and in my way.

Me:YES!

*Goes to Kerbal Space Program Website*

[Warning: mysql_connect(): Too many connections in /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/database.php on line 4

MySQL connect failed. Too many connections]

Me: oh...

And a fix the game braking bugs in Mac10os V9: Mavericks,hopefully. As in low graphical settings or no proper game play with out crashing horribly. (at-least I hope )

EDIT: nope, still broken. Darn it...

Edited December 18, 2013 by pigletx2

Not to harp on an excellent update to a great game, but does anyone else besides me think that the new in-game menus seem a bit...primitive? Like they belong in a really early build of KSP? I don't know. I love the tweakables and everything, but every time i look at them it's just...ugh. I don't know, mainly a petty complaint.
is KSP 64 bit now? (Or have they removed the 4GB memory cap?)

is KSP 64 bit now? (Or have they removed the 4GB memory cap?)

Don't think so.

is KSP 64 bit now?

No, not for Windows or OSX. Unity 3D still produces bugged code for Windows and OSX 64-bit versions. (I believe the Linix 64-bit works.)

Is anyone else seeing that the blue reticle for nodes appears to be more correct now? As in, when I line up with it on the other side of an orbit it is actually pointing the right way and there's not as much drift. Not sure if that's a result of the optimizations or if it was by chance, but it surprised me.
It did seem easier to steer/control for me, if that's what you meant magico13.

Not to harp on an excellent update to a great game, but does anyone else besides me think that the new in-game menus seem a bit...primitive? Like they belong in a really early build of KSP? I don't know. I love the tweakables and everything, but every time i look at them it's just...ugh. I don't know, mainly a petty complaint.

I don't think it's petty. But yes, the menus are bugging me as well. They look much less polished than they did in .22

Game's acting slow for me when I've got any terrain in view. I've had to take to positioning the camera below my rockets when I launch them. Not confined to Kerbin either; I put a sat around Moho last night and it didn't want to pan with the planet in the bg. Not necessarily a new bug but it's gotten more pronounced in 0.23.
